newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on Thursday on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate rose slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.90/2.85 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 2.70/2.65 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.82/2.77 percent against 2.65/2.60 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 ended at S$98.32/98.37 from Wednesday's close of S$98.42/98.47, May 2002 at S$99.38/99.48 versus S$99.42/99.47 and June 2003 at S$94.40/94.45 against S$94.44/94.49.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 2-1/2 2-3/8 percent from Wednesday's 1-3/4 1-1/2 percent.
